results.title: A Bridge in music
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Alexander Shaw and Unesco
results.brief_description: Yehudi Menuhin and Eastern musician Ayana Deva Angadi compare Eastern and Western music and discuss how we can come to understand and appreciate that which is foreign to us in terms of that which is familiar. Characteristic techniques are shown, and the film includes examples of music from India, Japan, Cambodia, Italy, Germany and France.
results.description: Yehudi Menuhin and Eastern musician Ayana Deva Angadi compare Eastern and Western music and discuss how we can come to understand and appreciate that which is foreign to us in terms of that which is familiar. results.title: The Destruction of St. Patrick's College 1971
results.brief_description: The old St Patrick’s College was demolished to make way for an ecclesiastic office building. Professor Hartley Gratten, of the University of Texas considers, against the background of the demolition by Whelan the Wrecker, why Australians ignore their national heritage.

results.title: Ask an Australian about her household [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Kay Roberts and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: Shows the way of life common to an Australian housewife in her household management, and the goods, services and types of housing available - (1970’s point-of-view). Note: young male child nude in shower scene, may not be suitable for public screening. Note: In Italian.

results.title: Adam and Eve
results.brief_description: An animated film using abstract cutouts, symbolising life, reproduction, growth and destruction from creation to the end of the world in an explosion, then the beginning of a new cycle.

results.title: Angkor, the lost city
results.creator_credit: Roger Blais and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Angkor - a whole metropolis of palaces and temples recovered from the jungle which hid them for centuries until discovered in 1860 by a French naturalist. Monuments, picture tapestries in stone and Angkor Vat, a mile square temple of grey sandstone which no other church has rivalled in size, reveal the glories of the past empire of the Khmers, ancestors of the Cambodians.

results.title: Ask an Australian about driving [Serbo Croat version]
results.creator_credit: Kay Roberts and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: Shows various driving conditions that may be encountered in Australia. The demands of both city and country driving are dealt with. Different traffic regulations in each state are explained, with emphasis on the need to obey traffic signs and laws. Shows how to set about buying a car. Note: In Serbo-Croatian.

results.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from East Gippsland
results.creator_credit: David Withers, ACMI and Csilla Csongvay
results.brief_description: The towns of Swifts Creek, Omeo, Lakes Entrance, Orbost, Marlo and Cape Conran are quite distinct from each other but all make up the region of East Gippsland, which lies in the south-east of Victoria. In ‘ACMI in the regions: stories from East Gippsland’, locals from each town are interviewed about their lives, their community and what makes living in these towns so special.

results.title: Welcome to Cape Conran
results.creator_credit: Kim Montgomery, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: Have you ever wondered what it’s like to live and work in a National Park? Cape Conran Coastal Park consists of 11,700 hectares of pristine coastal wilderness. Meet Carla and Josh Puglisi who manage the park as well as Mike Irvine; the park ranger, as they talk about the importance of protecting the coastal environment, the rich indigenous history of the area as well as what it’s like living within and raising families in such a beautiful place.
results.description: Have you ever wondered what it’s like to live and work in a National Park? Cape Conran Coastal Park consists of 11,700 hectares of pristine coastal wilderness. results.title: The Swifts Creek Bush Nursing Centre
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: The small country town of Swifts Creek has had a bush nursing service since 1918 when staff were originally travelling on horseback. These days the bush nurse Sue Carroll visits patients in a 4WD and understands the importance of providing medical care to locals that are often isolated and unable to travel to the Omeo Hospital. Whether it’s farmers in need of wound management, children with the measles or victims of car accidents, Carroll is usually the first person on the scene. Part nurse, part social worker, all legend; Carroll and the staff at the Swifts Creek Bush Nursing Centre provide a vital 24/7 service to not only the local community but the wider surrounding regional area.

Whether it’s farmers in need of wound management, children with the measles or victims of car accidents, Carroll is usually the first person on the scene. Part nurse, part social worker, all legend; Carroll and the staff at the Swifts Creek Bush Nursing Centre provide a vital 24/7 service to not only the local community but the wider surrounding regional area.

results.title: Respect and Belonging
results.creator_credit: Kim Montgomery, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: Learn about the Lake Tyres Indigenous community and the interesting life of elder; Aunty Phyllis Andy. As a respected Elder, pastor and community health worker, Aunty Phyllis Andy feels a strong connection not only to the land but the people that live within it. She understands the importance of connecting with the next generation and uses storytelling to pass on respect and culture to the young indigenous people of her community.
